sentence.Network_en: He could not dislodge the images imprinted on his brain.
sentence.Network_cn: 他难以把刻在脑海中的形象抹去。

sentence.Network_en: The thorn of bone may dislodge from his throat without surgery.
sentence.Network_cn: 也许不用动手术就能去除他喉咙卡着的那块骨刺.

sentence.Network_en: He may challenge the Prime Minister even if he decides he cannot dislodge her this time.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管他认为他这次并不能把首相赶下台，但他可能还是要向她挑战。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French deslogier, from des- (expressing reversal) + logier 'encamp', from loge (see lodge)

entry.tran: (从固定位置上)取出，去除，移动
entry.def: To dislodge something means to remove it from where it was fixed or held.

example.ex: Rainfall had dislodged debris from the slopes of the volcano...
example.tran: 雨水冲走了火山坡面上的岩屑。

example.ex: In the exertion Tompkins' hat had become dislodged.
example.tran: 汤普金斯的帽子被一把拽了下来。

entry.def: To dislodge a person from a position or job means to remove them from it.

example.ex: He may challenge the Prime Minister even if he decides he cannot dislodge her this time.
example.tran: 尽管他认为他这次并不能把首相赶下台，但他可能还是要向她挑战。

means.word_mean: 1. remove or force out from a position;

sentences.sentence: "The dentist dislodged the piece of food that had been stuck under my gums"
"He finally could free the legs of the earthquake victim who was buried in the rubble"

means.word_mean: 3. remove or force from a position of dwelling previously occupied;

sentences.sentence: "The new employee dislodged her by moving into her office space"

auth_sentence.content: But the ideas themselves are harder to dislodge.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the ideas themselves are harder to dislodge.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the ideas themselves are harder to dislodge.

auth_sentence.content: Some people think they are doing it to dislodge parasites such as leeches.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some people think they are doing it to dislodge parasites such as leeches.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some people think they are doing it to dislodge parasites such as leeches.

auth_sentence.content: But he survived early attempts to dislodge him and took increasingly risky gambles.
auth_sentence.res_content: But he survived early attempts to dislodge him and took increasingly risky gambles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But he survived early attempts to dislodge him and took increasingly risky gambles.

means.word_mean: 把…赶出, 从…逐出;把…移去

sentences.en: The coughing dislodged the fishbone from his throat.
sentences.cn: 他一咳嗽就把卡在喉咙里的鱼刺咳出来了。
